Package rover

Class Beeper

java.lang.Object
rover.Beeper
public class Beeper
extends java.lang.Object
The Beeper static class is designed to help developers to use the leJOS' Sound class more easily.
Author:
Antoine Stevan

  • Field Details

    • LOW_PICTH

      public static int LOW_PICTH
      A low pitch used to play simple music. For example, when one calls the play(int) method with the wanted sequence, a low note is played whenever a bit of the sequence is 0.
      See Also:
      play(int)

    • HIGH_PITCH

      public static int HIGH_PITCH
      A high pitch used to play simple music. For example, when one calls the play(int) method with the wanted sequence, a high note is played whenever a bit of the sequence is 1.
      See Also:
      play(int)

  • Constructor Details

    • Beeper

      public Beeper()

  • Method Details

    • alarm

      public static void alarm​(int frequency, int duration)
      Plays an alarm for some amount of time (blocking method). When given a frequency and a total duration, alarm(int, int) computes the period between two beeps and play the right amount of beeps so that the alarm plays during duration.
      Parameters:
      frequency - the frequency of the alarm (in Hz)
      duration - the length of the alarm (in ms)

    • beep

      public static void beep()
      A wrapper method of the Sound.beep() method. Plays a single beep and let the program continue.
      See Also:
      Sound.beep()

    • beep

      public static void beep​(int beeps, int period)
      Overload of the Sound.beep() wrapper. One gives a number of beeps to be heard and the period between two consecutive beeps.
      Parameters:
      beeps - the number of beeps to be heard.
      period - the period (in ms) between two beeps.

    • twoBeeps

      public static void twoBeeps()
      A wrapper method of the Sound.twoBeeps() method. Plays two beeps and let the program continue.
      See Also:
      Sound.twoBeeps()

    • play

      public static void play​(int mode, int[] inst, int delay)
      Plays a little music sequence to introduce a mode for the rover (see interface RoverMode) (blocking method). Throughout its life, the rover will be in different states, called modes. To help the developers and the audience to debug and understand what is going on without looking at the console -one can find more informations on the console, but the sounds are meant to be a summary- when the rover enters a new mode, a unique sequence of notes will be played. As there are less than 8 modes, the integer code of a mode is coded with three bits. When decoded, a 0 correspond to a low note (see LOW_PICTH) and a 1 is a high note (see HIGH_PITCH). With this method, the instrument and the delays can be precised, see play(int) for a default use.
      Parameters:
      mode - the integer code of the mode
      inst - the instrument to be used during the sequence of notes (see Sound.playNote(int[], int, int) for more details about instruments).
      delay - the length of each note and the time between two notes.
      See Also:
      RoverMode, LOW_PICTH, HIGH_PITCH, play(int)

    • play

      public static void play​(int mode)
      Plays a little music sequence to introduce a mode for the rover (see interface RoverMode) (blocking method). Throughout its life, the rover will be in different states, called modes. To help the developers and the audience to debug and understand what is going on without looking at the console -one can find more informations on the console, but the sounds are meant to be a summary- when the rover enters a new mode, a unique sequence of notes will be played. As there are less than 8 modes, the integer code of a mode is coded with three bits. When decoded, a 0 correspond to a low note (see LOW_PICTH) and a 1 is a high note (see HIGH_PITCH). default values: - instrument = Sound.PIANO - delay = 50 ms.
      Parameters:
      mode - the integer code of the mode
      See Also:
      RoverMode, LOW_PICTH, HIGH_PITCH
